title: Poster, "The Stepford Wives", 1975–76
provenance: Acquired from dealers, galleries and auction houses by Marc Benda.  Remained with Benda until 2010, when gifted to CHNDM.
creditline: Gift of Sara and Marc Benda
description:
On deep blue background, fading towards center: a yellow surface with broken-off hand and head of an attractive, stylish woman. 

Inscriptions: top-center in yellow, the title “The Stepford Wives", followed below at left, in white, with: "Something strange is happening  / in the town of Stepford. / When the men spend their nights doing something secret, / And every woman acts like every man's dream of the / "perfect" wife. / When a young woman watches the / dream become a nightmare / And sees the nightmare engulf her best friends, / And realizes that any moment, any second-- / her turn is coming. ", and at right in yellow: "KATHERINE ROSS PAULA PRENTISS / NANETTE NEWMAN / PATRICK O'NEAL". At mid left, in yellow: "CONTEMPORARY / FILMS / RELEASE", and at mid-right: "DIRECTED BY / BRYAN FORBES." Followed by a black band at bottom, with inscription in yellow "SCREENPLAY BY WILLIAM GOLDMAN  FROM THE NOVEL BY IRA LEVIN  AUTHOR OF  'ROSEMARY'S BABY' & 'BOYS FROM BRAZIL'.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "The Stepford Wives", 1975–76.
1975–76. Screenprint. Gift of Sara and Marc Benda. 2010-21-24.
